messages.message: things are up, but now am getting licensing errors
@Karthik S have we enabled licensing service on prod?
I had to disable the licensing service temporarily for now.  Will enable it after tomorrow’s session.
perfect — not sure what happened today after the cluster recreation, so temporarily disabled it
can we work tomorrow to enable it back?
Ok - I can look at it as well. Did we change any databases?
No, I just restarted all the services

```"2021/03/24 01:03:34 ERROR licenseservice/utils/license_get_db.go:106 -- [INVALID]: Could Not Get License: dial tcp: lookup instabase-backend-db-cluster.cluster-cyt8gw1zk6xv.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com (http://instabase-backend-db-cluster.cluster-cyt8gw1zk6xv.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com) on 10.66.176.10:53: read udp 10.68.45.16:53643->10.66.176.10:53: read: connection refused```
I see, I did not change anything here :neutral_face:
It looks like the Database connection was refused.

```Error

After killing the Pod and bringing back up - Things are fine.
okay awesome, I’ll enable licensing again.
I can look into ways on how we can recover from such failures automatically. Keeping @Naveen in loop
it might help in other services as well!
